data.author: sandy081

data.title: aux window - scoped services alignments
data.description:
Before this change, responsibility for who creates scoped services or uses them was not clear. We should implement a top-to-bottom approach where the right instantiation service is used that is already scoped so that downstream components do not have to worry.

Floating windows make this more complex, but here is the rough idea:
* we have 1-N editor parts (1 main, N floating)
* we support editor part scoped instantiation services with
  * a scoped context key service (on the part editor container)
  * a scoped editor service (only looking at groups of the main or floating editor part)
  * a scoped status service (scoped to either main or a floating window)

The methods to create scoped versions of status and editor service are only being used in 2 places now, for the main part and a floating window editor part. Specifically we fix the debt that down stream components like title or status bar used to create their own scoped versions of services depending on the editor part that was passed in.

The method to get the scoped instantiation service for an editor part adopts this new pattern for the main part and ensures the service scoping matches with floating windows (context key, editor, status service).

data.description:
This PR includes parcel/watcher in the compliance scans again so we at least know what potential compliance issues our usage of it could bring.

In the worst case, BinSkim issues can be closed as External, but APIScan issues would need to be resolved through upstream patches or through forking and patching.

data.title: add opt-in setting to gracefully kill terminal processes
data.description:
fix #206607

Tested on macOS and Windows.

cc @Tyriar 

Before:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bd41bad6-4ba5-45f3-b7ea-35b9878d5411

After (works when killing via trash can or after closing and reopening the window):

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/08ee1f52-ccf8-46ab-95e1-71124b477e5f
change_type_reasons: NLP semantic similarity to fix patterns: 0.27
NLP semantic similarity to feature patterns: 0.11
NLP semantic similarity to doc patterns: 0.00
Confidence below threshold, defaulting to feature

pr_comments.body: For conpty dll path `useConptyDll` we actually perform a graceful shutdown by default https://github.com/microsoft/node-pty/blob/d738123f1faf7287513b0df8b9e327be54702e94/src/windowsPtyAgent.ts#L177-L184 , I wonder if we should doing a task kill in this case.
pr_comments.author: deepak1556

pr_comments.body: @deepak1556 , thanks for pointing this out. With `useConptyDll` enabled, I’m not seeing graceful shutdown behavior in practice - IE the address reports it's still in use. That makes me wonder if we should be using `taskkill.exe` in `node-pty` when `useConptyDll` is enabled?
pr_comments.author: meganrogge

pr_comments.body: I’m going to test this PR on Windows with `useConptyDll` disabled. If everything still works as expected, I’ll go ahead and merge it and open an issue in `node-pty` to discuss potentially adjusting the shutdown behavior when `useConptyDll` is enabled.
pr_comments.author: meganrogge

pr_comments.body: Yes, this also works with `useConptyDll` disabled — the process shuts down gracefully in that case as well. I’m wondering if we should apply this logic regardless of whether `useConptyDll` is enabled?
pr_comments.author: meganrogge

data.title: [typescript-language-features] Add configuration for maximum hover length
data.description:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:
* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them.
-->

Fixes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/233557.

TS counterpart: https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/pull/61662
change_type_reasons: NLP semantic similarity to fix patterns: 0.15
NLP semantic similarity to feature patterns: 0.25
NLP semantic similarity to doc patterns: 0.00

pr_comments.body:
For new settings like these, let's start using a single setting instead of duplicating it for javascript and typescript. IO suggest calling it: `js/ts.hover.maximumLength`

If you set the scope to `"resource"`, then it can be configured per language as well using language specific settings
pr_comments.author: mjbvz

pr_comments.body:
How do we then fetch this setting in the code?
`getPreferences` currently does this:
```ts
const config = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration(
			isTypeScriptDocument(document) ? 'typescript' : 'javascript',
			document);
```
pr_comments.author: gabritto

pr_comments.body: You'll need to get the `js/ts` configuration section: `const jsTsConfig = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('js/ts', document)`.
pr_comments.author: mjbvz
